properties.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 1 at 4:30PM CST until January 2 at 4:30PM CST by NWS Bismarck ND
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in Bismarck has issued a

* Flood Advisory for Rapid Rises for...
An Ice Jam in...
Western Burleigh County in south central North Dakota...
Northeastern Morton County in south central North Dakota...

* Until 430 PM CST Thursday.

* At 424 PM CST, the public reported an ice jam causing minor
flooding from Misty Waters up through Hoge Island on the Bismarck
side of the Missouri River, and Square Butte Creek areas.

An ice jam caused by recent cold weather is affecting water levels
in rural developments along the Missouri River up north of the
Bismarck and Mandan area. Without warning, rapid rises in water
levels due to shifting and accumulating ice are expected over the
next 24 hours.
properties.instruction:
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the
dangers of flooding.

Please report flooding to your local law enforcement agency when you
can do so safely.
